result.execSummary:
The defendant Tony Terrell Talbert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony Terrell Talbert

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tony Terrell Talbert not in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant and Defense Counsel NOT in court. Case recalled to address due date of court ordered costs, fees, and surcharges. Court ordered all court costs, fees, and surcharges previously ordered to be paid by 5/14/2016, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. Court further ordered that the DNA surcharge ordered at the time of Sentencing be VACATED. The DNA surcharge does NOT apply in this case.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to each other, but consecutive to any other sentence, with Huber. Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Restitution set at ZERO.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to each other, but consecutive to any other sentence, with Huber. Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Restitution set at ZERO.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Tony Terrell Talbert in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Tony Terrell Talbert in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing. 
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court amended Counts 1 & 2 To REMOVE the Repeater enhancer (939.62(1)(a)).

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Tony Terrell Talbert not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Tony Terrell Talbert
Current: 6607 W BIRCH ST, Milwaukee, WI 53225   (Effective: 03-26-2015)
Prior: 1242 North 12th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53205

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with NATASHA C., SHARON C., AND DEMETRIUS R.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tony Terrell Talbert in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Defendant Tony Terrell Talbert in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
